intro: Lotononis woodii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Lotononis woodii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
